com.alexkasko.netty.ftp

Class FtpServerHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jboss.netty.channel.SimpleChannelUpstreamHandler
      • com.alexkasko.netty.ftp.FtpServerHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.jboss.netty.channel.ChannelHandler, org.jboss.netty.channel.ChannelUpstreamHandler

    public class FtpServerHandler
extends org.jboss.netty.channel.SimpleChannelUpstreamHandler
    Netty handler, partial implementation of RFC 959 "File Transfer Protocol (FTP)" for receiving FTP files. Both active and passive modes are supported.
    Author:
    alexkasko Date: 12/27/12

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.jboss.netty.channel.ChannelHandler

        org.jboss.netty.channel.ChannelHandler.Sharable

      • FtpServerHandler

        public FtpServerHandler(DataReceiver receiver)
        Constructor for FTP active mode
        Parameters:

      • FtpServerHandler

        public FtpServerHandler(DataReceiver receiver,
                InetAddress passiveAddress,
                InetAddress passiveAdvertisedAddress,
                int lowestPassivePort,
                int highestPassivePort,
                int passiveOpenAttempts,
                int passiveSoTimeoutMillis)
        Constructor for FTP passive mode
        Parameters:
        receiver - data receiver implementation
        passiveAddress - passive IP address that will be used for server socket bind
        passiveAdvertisedAddress - passive IP address that will be advertized to client
        lowestPassivePort - lowest bound of passive ports range
        highestPassivePort - highest bound of passive ports range
        passiveOpenAttempts - number of ports to choose for passive socket open before reporting error

      • FtpServerHandler

        public FtpServerHandler(DataReceiver receiver,

                int passiveSoTimeoutMillis)
        Constructor for FTP passive mode with separate advertized address
        Parameters:
        receiver - data receiver implementation
        passiveAddress - passive IP address that will be used for server socket bind
        passiveAdvertisedAddress - passive IP address that will be advertized to client
        lowestPassivePort - lowest bound of passive ports range
        highestPassivePort - highest bound of passive ports range
        passiveOpenAttempts - number of ports to choose for passive socket open before reporting error
